examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
You know, maybe that old guy was yanking our chain.
They've suffered a heart attack, maybe two.
If you're not prepared to handle the pressure, then maybe this job isn't for you.
Maybe I should take a leaf out of Rick's book and start coming in early every morning.
words.defineEn: used to show that you are uncertain about the occurrence, correctness, or truth of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng bạn không chắc chắn về sự xuất hiện, tính chính xác hoặc sự thật của một cái gì đó

examples: Rumors never passed her lips.
Meat and mass never hindered man.
Wonders never cease!
Wonders never cease!
A watched pot never boils.
words.defineEn: not even once in the past or not happening in the future
words.defineVi: thậm chí không một lần trong quá khứ hoặc không xảy ra trong tương lai

examples: My favorite smoothie recipe always includes the juiciness of a Jaffa orange.
My parents always took an interest in my hobbies.
My father always had a lead foot.
Election season always puts my dad's back up.
Always keep a backup of the file.
words.defineEn: at every single moment or every single time something happens
words.defineVi: tại mỗi thời điểm hoặc mỗi lần một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: Election season always puts my dad's back up.
Dr. Jaffe pinned her ears back.
Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
I ran the tape back.
The enemy was driven back.
words.defineEn: in the direction behind us
words.defineVi: theo hướng phía sau chúng tôi

examples: Most families have one or two skeletons in the closet.
Most students are close to the breadline.
Men still hold most positions of power in this country.
Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
words.defineEn: used for forming the superlative of several adverbs and adjectives
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hình thành so sánh nhất của một số trạng từ và tính từ

examples: Grasp all, lose all.
After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
words.defineEn: to the full or complete degree
words.defineVi: đến mức độ đầy đủ hoặc hoàn thành

examples: The overwhelming majority of Irish-Americans probably persuaded the administration that the cake was not worth the candle.
Probably the only one who can see the forest for the trees.
He probably got them off the back of a truck.
We should probably invest in a good home security system.
I can probably reach him on his mobile.
words.defineEn: used for saying that something is likely to happen or be the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: My knowledge of French is pretty basic.
The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
The board meeting painted a pretty grim picture.
Those movie stars live pretty high off the hog.
Years of war have left their mark on these pretty islands.
words.defineEn: to a degree that is high but not very high
words.defineVi: ở mức độ cao nhưng không cao lắm

examples: Will wonders ever cease?
Would wonders ever cease?
Nobody has ever made head or tail of Greek music.
Have you ever used this software before?
Have you ever looked a gift horse in the mouth?
words.defineEn: on any occasion; at any time
words.defineVi: vào bất kỳ dịp nào; bất cứ lúc nào

examples: Wow, all his geese are swans, all right!
Everything will be all right.
It's all right for some, huh?
All right, let's kick it into high gear for the last part of today's workout!
It’s all right for Washington, but will it sell in small-town America?
words.defineEn: to an extent or in a manner that is acceptable
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ hoặc trong một cách đó là chấp nhận được

examples: The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Over seven hundred Facebook users have already liked the company’s website.
Important new laws are already in the pipeline.
The separation from Julie was already difficult for Alex.
Your son is in high school already?
words.defineEn: before now or a specific point in time
words.defineVi: trước bây giờ hoặc một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: Of course there is some truth in all this, but only up to a point.
Of course we're not going to sell the house!
Of course I'll be there - with bells on!
Of course we'll change it for a larger size, Madam.
Of course, I suppose 20 years does make a lot of difference.
words.defineEn: used to give permission or express agreement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho phép hoặc bày tỏ sự đồng ý

examples: Better ask teacher about.
I just about busted a gut.
The boss of the failed company is keeping schtum about his role in the disaster.
The plane holds about 300 passengers.
The plane holds about 300 passengers.
words.defineEn: used with a number to show that it is not exact
words.defineVi: được sử dụng với một số để chỉ ra rằng nó không chính xác

examples: My mother throws that far away.
I've saved almost £100 so far.
The kangaroo can jump very far with its powerful hind legs.
The music was far too loud for my liking.
They went farther north into the mountains.
words.defineEn: to or at a great distance
words.defineVi: đến hoặc ở một khoảng cách lớn

examples: She wears her hair long.
This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Our players kept the pedal to the metal all season long.
The kids are under my feet all day long.
North Korea’s refusal had long been a sticking point.
words.defineEn: for a great amount of time
words.defineVi: trong một khoảng thời gian dài

examples: Together, the ant colony was greater than the sum of its parts.
They play the guitar together during jam sessions.
The family took a vacation together, creating wonderful memories with their children.
They did everything together.
They stayed together for the sake of the children.
words.defineEn: near to or with something or someone else
words.defineVi: gần hoặc với một cái gì đó hoặc người khác

examples: Her skirt almost reached the ground.
Robins build nests almost anywhere.
She almost shouted bloody murder on top of her lungs.
The poor girl was almost beside herself.
The recent economic recovery was almost entirely led by exports.
words.defineEn: used to say that something is nearly the case but not completely
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó gần đúng nhưng không hoàn toàn

examples: He feels the cold a lot.
I learned a lot from my father.
A lot has happened inside these four walls.
She has a lot on her plate right now.
Apparently, Meg's cooking leaves a lot to be desired.
words.defineEn: to a large degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn

examples: Mrs. Thatcher held the post of prime minister longer than anyone else last century.
I'm completely in the dark, like everyone else.
There was no one else to take up the cudgels on their behalf.
The buck stops with the players, not with the manager or anybody else.
When Mary starts talking, no one else can get a word in edgeways.
words.defineEn: in addition to what is already mentioned or known
words.defineVi: ngoài những gì đã được đề cập hoặc biết

examples: The store sometimes offers discounts on certain items.
We sometimes have a barbecue in the backyard.
Sometimes darkness can show you the light.
She sometimes picked fights with other girls at school.
She sometimes practices yoga in the morning.
words.defineEn: on some occasions but not always
words.defineVi: trong một số dịp nhưng không phải lúc nào

examples: Retirement often brings with it a massive drop in income.
My vegetarian friend often uses beans as a filling for vegetarian tacos.
Parents often support their children financially during college.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
He often picks a quarrel.
words.defineEn: many times or on many occasions
words.defineVi: nhiều lần hoặc trong nhiều dịp

examples: had a stab at surfing once
The committee meets once a fortnight.
My family goes on a vacation once a year.
She once went down that political rabbit hole.
I do aerobics once a week.
words.defineEn: for one single time
words.defineVi: cho một lần duy nhất

examples: I'm taking the kids swimming later.
Three days later a rash appeared.
A few weeks later, I landed my dream job.
Please try again later.
The long arm of the law finally caught up with him 30 years later.
words.defineEn: at some point in the future; after the time mentioned
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm nào đó trong tương lai; sau thời gian được đề cập

examples: Patience isn't exactly her strong suit.
I make that exactly $50.
Their life together hasn't exactly been a bed of roses.
The role isn't exactly a walk in the park.
At the age of 75, the singer is not exactly in the prime of his life!
words.defineEn: used to indicate that something is completely accurate or correct
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó là hoàn toàn chính xác hoặc chính xác

examples: Basically, he was a bully, and like most bullies, he could dish it out, but couldn't take it.
The company wants to hire her at any cost, so she can basically take her pick of perks during the negotiation process.
Your grandmother will be there, and she is basically Mrs. Grundy!
The cast of 'Spring Awakening' was there, basically.
Drones date back much longer to early flight but like the modern drones basically trace their origin to the 80s.
words.defineEn: used to state one’s opinion while emphasizing or summarizing its most important aspects
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nêu ý kiến của một người trong khi nhấn mạnh hoặc tóm tắt các khía cạnh quan trọng nhất của nó
